messages.message:
I think we need to update the script to call the model with a version number.

This demo is working on demo.ib, here https://demo.instabase.com/apps/refiner-v5/edit/demo/demos/fs/Instabase%20Drive/Featur[…]tural%20Language/Employment%20Letter/prog/refiner.ibrefiner (https://demo.instabase.com/apps/refiner-v5/edit/demo/demos/fs/Instabase%20Drive/Features/Natural%20Language/Employment%20Letter/prog/refiner.ibrefiner)
can you send me cred that works for demo environment

FYI with the 21.10.0 release, any existing models need to be re-published, and you may also need to update your UDFs. Among other things, we're now enforcing a `version_number` in the model request (See this doc (https://docs.google.com/document/d/1aoEL2WQPtxD3D5hXO9ap5e4-lVVAyZZyt9a4uVdVZmY/edit#heading=h.dgt4x8nttxon), section Re-publish models)
All, I'm all good for the demo

@Anant I’ve updated the employment letter demo to work on the Oct release. From your earlier screenshot it looks like you have your own copy that will need to be updated too.

In models.py add `model_version='0.0.2'`  as a new param to the RunModelRequest. Here’s what the call should look like:

>   req = model_service_pb2.RunModelRequest(
>       context=ms._get_context(),
>       model_service_context=model_service_pb2.ModelServiceContext(
>         model_paths=[‘vontell/model-service/fs/Instabase Drive/ib-models/’]
>       ),
>       input_string=context,
>       model_name=‘ib_qa’,
>       *`model_version='0.0.2',`* # new param required for Oct release
>       model_payload=model_service_pb2.ModelPayload(
>             question_answer_request=model_service_pb2.QuestionAnswerRequest(
>                 question=question)))
